title: The Shell
text:
echo string: String/Variable output
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ echo "hello"
hello

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ echo it is a test
it is a test

title: The Shell
text:
echo string: String/Variable output
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ echo "hello"
hello

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ echo it is a test
it is a test

title: The Shell
text:
cd and pwd
pwd: display the current directory cd .: to the current directory cd ..: to its parent directory cd dir_name: to dir_name directory cd ~: to the home cd -: to the last visited directory
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ pwd
/e/blog

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /
$ cd /e/blog
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ cd -
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /

hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /
$ cd ~
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 ~

title: The Shell
text:
ls
ls: display all the content in the current directory ls -l: display the details of content
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ ls -l
total 4
drwxr-xr-x 1 hao 197609 0 11月 20 23:26 _site/
drwxr-xr-x 1 hao 197609 0 11月 21 16:54 Missing_Semester/
drwxr-xr-x 1 hao 197609 0 11月 14 21:31 posts/
drwxr-xr-x 1 hao 197609 0 11月 21 16:49 WEEK_REPORT/

d refers to a directory
rwx: read, write, execute
rwx refers to the owner of the file’s permissions
r-x refers to the group of the file’s permissions
r-x refers to anyone else’s permissions

title: The Shell
text:
rmdir and mkdir
rmdir dir_name : Delete empty dirs mkdir dir_name: Building a new directory
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ mkdir 1
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ ls
_site/  1/  Missing_Semester/  posts/  WEEK_REPORT/
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ rmdir 1
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ ls
_site/  Missing_Semester/  posts/  WEEK_REPORT/

title: The Shell
text:
cat
cat file_nameandcat file1 file2: Displaying file contents cat file1 file2 > combined_file: Redirecting files contents to other file cat > newfile: Reading and saving content from the terminal cat >> existing_file: Appending content to an existing file
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ cat > main1.py
print("hello")
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ cat > main2.py
print("hao")
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ cat main1.py main2.py
print("hello")
print("hao")
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ cat main1.py main2.py > main.py
hao@DESKTOP-EUJ3G2G MINGW64 /e/blog
$ python main.py
hello
hao

title: The Shell
text:
pipe character
|: Using the output of one command as input to another command (Waiting for construction…)

title: The Shell
text:
touch
touch file_name: Update the access and modification times of each FILE to the current time.
